title: Nicodemus National Historic Site: Volunteer
body: Volunteer       Today's volunteers are active, dynamic, creative individuals of all ages who possess the skills, desire, patience, and time to accomplish a wide variety of tasks and to become part of the National Park Service community. Volunteers are, without a doubt, Very-Important-People! There are many opportunities to volunteer at Nicodemus National Historic Site. They include preservation and maintenance of cultural and natural resources, historic and cultural research, working in the visitor center, office/clerical work, and developing interpretive programs. You may volunteer at Nicodemus National Historic Site by submitting a Volunteer application online or mailing it to: VIP Coordinator Nicodemus National Historic Site 304 Washington Avenue  Nicodemus, Kansas 67625     If you have questions about our volunteer opportunities you may email us, or call us at 785-839-4233.  Â     Nicodemus Volunteer NPS Photo
